alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 3:16PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 345 PM MDT... At 316 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Kit Carson, or 20 miles west of Cheyenne Wells, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Firstview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for east central Colorado.
